page.title: 04Farm Mechanisation.
page.content: Mechanisation on the farms has caused a fall in the number of employed on the estate. Machines are growing in size and versatillity making farming far more economical and time saving. Devon country lanes which provide access to the fields remain the same so there is a limit to the size of machinery that can be used in the forseeable future. The first tractor appeared on the estate in 1934, spares were hard to come by so when a front wheel collapsed it had to be replaced by a home-made wooden one.In 1947 a Ferguson tractor cost Â£430. Recently the estate has just replaced its tractors with six Deutz machines each costing around Â£27,000.
